metadata: {'title': ['RNA sensing induced by chromosome missegregation augments anti-tumor immunity VI'], 'geo_accession': ['GSE281352'], 'status': ['Public on Nov 12 2024'], 'submission_date': ['Nov 07 2024'], 'last_update_date': ['Nov 12 2024'], 'summary': ['We demonstrate that dsRNA is significantly accumulated in cancer cells following pharmacologic induction of micronuclei, stimulating MAVS-mediated dsRNA sensing in conjunction with the cGAS/STING pathway. Activation of cytosolic dsRNA sensing co-operates with dsDNA sensing to up-regulate immune cell migration and antigen-presenting machinery. Tracing of dsRNA-sequence identity revealed that dsRNA-forming transcripts are predominantly generated from non-exonic regions, particularly in locations proximal to genes exhibiting high chromatin accessibility. Activation of this pathway by pulsed Monopolar Spindle 1 (MPS1) kinase inhibitor therapy, which potently induces micronuclei formation, thus induces cytoplasmic dsRNA-sensing and promotes anti-tumor immunity mediated by type I interferon signaling and cytotoxic lymphocyte activation in vivo. Taken together, these findings reveal a novel aspect of the dsRNA-sensing pathway in enhancing the anti-tumor efficacy of drugs that promote genomic instability and micronuclei formation, facilitating cancer immunogenicity.'], 'overall_design': ['We invetigated the alteration of open chromatin following pulsed MPS1 treatment in H1944 cells.'], 'type': ['Genome binding/occupancy profiling by high throughput sequencing'], 'contributor': ['Nobunari,,Sasaki', 'Mizuki,,Homme', 'Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'sample_id': ['GSM8619120', 'GSM8619121', 'GSM8619122', 'GSM8619123'], 'contact_name': ['Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'contact_email': ['shunsuke.kitajima@jfcr.or.jp'], 'contact_institute': ['Japanese Foundation for Cancer Research'], 'contact_address': ['3-8-31 Ariake, Koto'], 'contact_city': ['Tokyo'], 'contact_zip/postal_code': ['1358550'], 'contact_country': ['Japan'], 'supplementary_file': ['ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281352/suppl/GSE281352_raw_counts.txt.gz'], 'platform_id': ['GPL28038'], 'platform_taxid': ['9606'], 'sample_taxid': ['9606'], 'relation': ['BioProject: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA1183430']}

Tracing of dsRNA-sequence identity revealed that dsRNA-forming transcripts are predominantly generated from non-exonic regions, particularly in locations proximal to genes exhibiting high chromatin accessibility. Activation of this pathway by pulsed Monopolar Spindle 1 (MPS1) kinase inhibitor therapy, which potently induces micronuclei formation, thus induces cytoplasmic dsRNA-sensing and promotes anti-tumor immunity mediated by type I interferon signaling and cytotoxic lymphocyte activation in vivo. Taken together, these findings reveal a novel aspect of the dsRNA-sensing pathway in enhancing the anti-tumor efficacy of drugs that promote genomic instability and micronuclei formation, facilitating cancer immunogenicity.'], 'overall_design': ['We invetigated STING and/or MAVS-dependent gene expression alteration following pulsed MPS1 treatment in H1944 cells.'], 'type': ['Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing'], 'contributor': ['Nobunari,,Sasaki', 'Mizuki,,Homme', 'Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'sample_id': ['GSM8619104', 'GSM8619105', 'GSM8619106', 'GSM8619107', 'GSM8619108', 'GSM8619109', 'GSM8619110', 'GSM8619111', 'GSM8619112', 'GSM8619113', 'GSM8619114', 'GSM8619115', 'GSM8619116', 'GSM8619117', 'GSM8619118', 'GSM8619119'], 'contact_name': ['Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'contact_email': ['shunsuke.kitajima@jfcr.or.jp'], 'contact_institute': ['Japanese Foundation for Cancer Research'], 'contact_address': ['3-8-31 Ariake, Koto'], 'contact_city': ['Tokyo'], 'contact_zip/postal_code': ['1358550'], 'contact_country': ['Japan'], 'supplementary_file': ['ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281351/suppl/GSE281351_raw_counts.txt.gz'], 'platform_id': ['GPL28038'], 'platform_taxid': ['9606'], 'sample_taxid': ['9606'], 'relation': ['BioProject: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA1183427']}

{'title': ['RNA sensing induced by chromosome missegregation augments anti-tumor immunity IV'], 'geo_accession': ['GSE281350'], 'status': ['Public on Nov 12 2024'], 'submission_date': ['Nov 07 2024'], 'last_update_date': ['Nov 12 2024'], 'summary': ['We demonstrate that dsRNA is significantly accumulated in cancer cells following pharmacologic induction of micronuclei, stimulating MAVS-mediated dsRNA sensing in conjunction with the cGAS/STING pathway. Activation of cytosolic dsRNA sensing co-operates with dsDNA sensing to up-regulate immune cell migration and antigen-presenting machinery. Tracing of dsRNA-sequence identity revealed that dsRNA-forming transcripts are predominantly generated from non-exonic regions, particularly in locations proximal to genes exhibiting high chromatin accessibility. Activation of this pathway by pulsed Monopolar Spindle 1 (MPS1) kinase inhibitor therapy, which potently induces micronuclei formation, thus induces cytoplasmic dsRNA-sensing and promotes anti-tumor immunity mediated by type I interferon signaling and cytotoxic lymphocyte activation in vivo. Taken together, these findings reveal a novel aspect of the dsRNA-sensing pathway in enhancing the anti-tumor efficacy of drugs that promote genomic instability and micronuclei formation, facilitating cancer immunogenicity.'], 'overall_design': ['We invetigated alteration of dsRNA-forming transcripts following pulsed MPS1 treatment in H1944 cells by utlizing J2-IP sequencing.'], 'type': ['Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing'], 'contributor': ['Nobunari,,Sasaki', 'Mizuki,,Homme', 'Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'sample_id': ['GSM8619100', 'GSM8619101', 'GSM8619102', 'GSM8619103'], 'contact_name': ['Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'contact_email': ['shunsuke.kitajima@jfcr.or.jp'], 'contact_institute': ['Japanese Foundation for Cancer Research'], 'contact_address': ['3-8-31 Ariake, Koto'], 'contact_city': ['Tokyo'], 'contact_zip/postal_code': ['1358550'], 'contact_country': ['Japan'], 'supplementary_file': ['ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281350/suppl/GSE281350_raw_counts_Input.txt.gz', 'ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281350/suppl/GSE281350_raw_counts_J2.txt.gz'], 'platform_id': ['GPL28038'], 'platform_taxid': ['9606'], 'sample_taxid': ['9606'], 'relation': ['BioProject: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA1183428']}

{'title': ['RNA sensing induced by chromosome missegregation augments anti-tumor immunity III'], 'geo_accession': ['GSE281349'], 'status': ['Public on Nov 12 2024'], 'submission_date': ['Nov 07 2024'], 'last_update_date': ['Nov 12 2024'], 'summary': ['We demonstrate that dsRNA is significantly accumulated in cancer cells following pharmacologic induction of micronuclei, stimulating MAVS-mediated dsRNA sensing in conjunction with the cGAS/STING pathway. Activation of cytosolic dsRNA sensing co-operates with dsDNA sensing to up-regulate immune cell migration and antigen-presenting machinery. Tracing of dsRNA-sequence identity revealed that dsRNA-forming transcripts are predominantly generated from non-exonic regions, particularly in locations proximal to genes exhibiting high chromatin accessibility. Activation of this pathway by pulsed Monopolar Spindle 1 (MPS1) kinase inhibitor therapy, which potently induces micronuclei formation, thus induces cytoplasmic dsRNA-sensing and promotes anti-tumor immunity mediated by type I interferon signaling and cytotoxic lymphocyte activation in vivo. Taken together, these findings reveal a novel aspect of the dsRNA-sensing pathway in enhancing the anti-tumor efficacy of drugs that promote genomic instability and micronuclei formation, facilitating cancer immunogenicity.'], 'overall_design': ['We invetigated MAVS-dependent gene expression alteration of tumor tissue following pulsed MPS1 treatment.'], 'type': ['Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing'], 'contributor': ['Nobunari,,Sasaki', 'Mizuki,,Homme', 'Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'sample_id': ['GSM8619088', 'GSM8619089', 'GSM8619090', 'GSM8619091', 'GSM8619092', 'GSM8619093', 'GSM8619094', 'GSM8619095', 'GSM8619096', 'GSM8619097', 'GSM8619098', 'GSM8619099'], 'contact_name': ['Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'contact_email': ['shunsuke.kitajima@jfcr.or.jp'], 'contact_institute': ['Japanese Foundation for Cancer Research'], 'contact_address': ['3-8-31 Ariake, Koto'], 'contact_city': ['Tokyo'], 'contact_zip/postal_code': ['1358550'], 'contact_country': ['Japan'], 'supplementary_file': ['ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281349/suppl/GSE281349_raw_counts.txt.gz'], 'platform_id': ['GPL24247'], 'platform_taxid': ['10090'], 'sample_taxid': ['10090'], 'relation': ['BioProject: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA1183429']}

{'title': ['RNA sensing induced by chromosome missegregation augments anti-tumor immunity II'], 'geo_accession': ['GSE281348'], 'status': ['Public on Nov 12 2024'], 'submission_date': ['Nov 07 2024'], 'last_update_date': ['Nov 12 2024'], 'summary': ['We demonstrate that dsRNA is significantly accumulated in cancer cells following pharmacologic induction of micronuclei, stimulating MAVS-mediated dsRNA sensing in conjunction with the cGAS/STING pathway. Activation of cytosolic dsRNA sensing co-operates with dsDNA sensing to up-regulate immune cell migration and antigen-presenting machinery. Tracing of dsRNA-sequence identity revealed that dsRNA-forming transcripts are predominantly generated from non-exonic regions, particularly in locations proximal to genes exhibiting high chromatin accessibility. Activation of this pathway by pulsed Monopolar Spindle 1 (MPS1) kinase inhibitor therapy, which potently induces micronuclei formation, thus induces cytoplasmic dsRNA-sensing and promotes anti-tumor immunity mediated by type I interferon signaling and cytotoxic lymphocyte activation in vivo. Taken together, these findings reveal a novel aspect of the dsRNA-sensing pathway in enhancing the anti-tumor efficacy of drugs that promote genomic instability and micronuclei formation, facilitating cancer immunogenicity.'], 'overall_design': ['We invetigated type1 IFN-dependent dsRNA-forming transcripts following pulsed MPS1 treatment in H1944 cells by utlizing J2-IP sequencing.'], 'type': ['Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing'], 'contributor': ['Nobunari,,Sasaki', 'Mizuki,,Homme', 'Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'sample_id': ['GSM8619076', 'GSM8619077', 'GSM8619078', 'GSM8619079', 'GSM8619080', 'GSM8619081', 'GSM8619082', 'GSM8619083', 'GSM8619084', 'GSM8619085', 'GSM8619086', 'GSM8619087'], 'contact_name': ['Shunsuke,,Kitajima'], 'contact_email': ['shunsuke.kitajima@jfcr.or.jp'], 'contact_institute': ['Japanese Foundation for Cancer Research'], 'contact_address': ['3-8-31 Ariake, Koto'], 'contact_city': ['Tokyo'], 'contact_zip/postal_code': ['1358550'], 'contact_country': ['Japan'], 'supplementary_file': ['ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/series/GSE281nnn/GSE281348/suppl/GSE281348_raw_counts.txt.gz'], 'platform_id': ['GPL28038'], 'platform_taxid': ['9606'], 'sample_taxid': ['9606'], 'relation': ['BioProject: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA1183422']}
